title: Pierogi Ruskie (Polish Dumplings)
description: Classic Polish dumplings with a savory filling of potatoes, farmer's cheese, and onions, boiled to perfection and served with fried onions and sour cream.
instructions: For dough: In a large bowl, mix flour and salt. Make a well and add egg, oil, and warm water. Mix until shaggy dough forms.
Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover with bowl and rest for 30 minutes.
For filling: Peel and boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain well and mash until smooth.
In a skillet, melt 50g butter and sauté chopped onions until golden and caramelized, about 15 minutes.
Mix mashed potatoes, farmer's cheese, caramelized onions (reserve some for garnish), remaining 50g butter, salt, and pepper. Mix until well combined. Let cool.
Divide dough into 4 portions. Roll one portion thin (about 2mm) on floured surface. Keep other portions covered.
Cut circles using a glass or 3-inch cutter. Place tablespoon of filling in center of each circle.
Fold dough over filling to create half-moon shape. Press edges firmly to seal, then crimp with fingers or fork.
Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Boil pierogi in batches (don't overcrowd) until they float, then cook 2-3 minutes more.
Remove with slotted spoon. Serve immediately with melted butter, caramelized onions, sour cream, chives, and crispy bacon if using.
Alternatively, after boiling, pan-fry in butter until golden and crispy on both sides.
